body:
When colour selection is sed to random, rather than randomise and police what colours are chosen, we could specify a selection of mod-specific colours which are known to be distinct and look good. For example, the original games each had a preset number of colours that could be used. See the top right here:

![RA95 skirmish lobby](http://www.mobygames.com/images/shots/l/64900-command-conquer-red-alert-the-aftermath-windows-screenshot.gif)
I'm all for the pre-set colors @pizzaoverhead but I was under the impression that many players wanted the color picker and not the pre-set colors...

This would be for automatic colours only. I've edited the above for clarity. You would still customise them however you wanted. If you don't care what the colours are, they should be sensible by default.
@pizzaoverhead do you want to generate a list of ~20 sensible colors for each mod?  I could then include them as part of the fix for #10906.

Also please consider choosing colors that contrast the ore, gems and terrain (grass, snow, sand, water) as some smaller units (rifle infantry etc...) can be hard to spot if they are in a color that's too similar to its surrounding. Thanks!
@pchote Sure, I'll put something together.

So far I've grabbed the original multiplayer colours from the three main mods in RGB format:

```
D2K
107, 130, 165   Grey teal
214, 81, 74     Light red
107, 162, 132   Dull green
123, 16, 140    Purple
132, 56, 16     Brown
173, 136, 8     Dark gold

RA
196, 176, 96    Copper
68, 148, 228    Blue
236, 0, 0       Red
0, 196, 0       Green
252, 136, 0     Orange
112, 112, 112   Grey
68, 144, 124    Teal
112, 44, 36     Burgundy

TD
252, 252, 84    Yellow
244, 0, 0       Red
0, 112, 112     Teal
212, 120, 16    Orange
84, 252, 84     Green
164, 164, 188   Grey
```

Thank you @pizzaoverhead for doing this.

Here's an image of how those colors look in sRGB.
(BTW: Do the ingame colors change maybe? I know I get a bit different colors in my screen grabs of the game compared to how they look in game ... but nothing drastic)

![openra_colors](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10639257/15427140/408b3ee8-1e93-11e6-8172-ad5e7a1e34b0.png)

By looking just at RA colors - are the "copper" and "teal" mybe a bit too close to the terrain (ore and grass)? Perhaps a bright yellow and pink as replacements for the two?

If you use predefined colors, what do you do if a map has more spawns than the number of predefined colors ?
For example if you play a ten players map in RA, the last two players still have a completely random color instead of a predefined one when they connect to the server ?
There was an idea of having X amount of predefined colors and Y amount of customizable slots per player. I do hope this latter is still planned otherwise the revamp is a clear step backwards.

This ticket is about the initial automatic colours that are assigned, and does not impact the UI in any way.  If there are more players than colors then it would fall back to its current method, but like I mentioned above I would like to have at least 20 decent colors to justify the effort of implementing this (its a waste of time if it can't even cope with our biggest shipped maps).

I feel 20 distinguishable colors is really hard to achieve.

Here's my take on 20 color selection. I tried to simulate the worst - small unit (rifle infantry) on different terrain. 

![ra_colors](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10639257/15496357/00a9314a-2195-11e6-9712-7adf78654a3e.png)

When automated color selection takes place it should still have an order in which it picks these colors, so that it will only take a second red when other hues are exhausted.

Edit:
If we order colors so that the less distingushable ones are selected only when there are many players, this wouldn't be so bad, since up to 8 players is more common I feel...

Maybe in an order _something like_ this (left to right): 
![ra_colors_order2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10639257/15499200/40a44592-21a3-11e6-8161-01707ce06811.png)
Edit (adjusted order a bit)

How can I add **fixed player color** to map.yaml **with skirmish maps?**
I'd like to further test (and later adjust if needed) these colors in-game.
Thanks.
https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/mods/cnc/maps/cnc64gdi01/map.yaml#L35
Thanks @GraionDilach I was able to achieve what I wanted with this. I'll post screens/colors as soon as I come up with it.

So here is my new ordered list with in-game screenshots:
![openra_colors_select_pi99y](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10639257/15504850/42630544-21c1-11e6-9b66-2969ac72ff5a.png)

Automated colors would be picked in order 1 - 20 from the list and skipped if too similar to hand-picked/default color of a human player.

The first two rows from the top (= first 10 colors) seem pretty distinguishable to me. What do you think?

10's tone should also be either darkened either 6 should be more desaturated, because they do look similar to me. Or drop 6 altogether, shift 19 into it's place and use a bit darker tone of the Munsell red - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shades_of_red#Red_.28Munsell.29 - (something along HSL 345-100%-35% or RGB 179-0-45) for the vacant slot. The distance between 8 and 18 should also be increased (by darkening/desaturating 18 or lightening 8 up). 1-17 is also an edge case, maybe lghten 1 up (that would even help on 1-3 as well).

It looks fine for the most part though.

Taking another look, 4-20 and 7-12 are also a pair which I'd say need to be differed. 12 prolly can be hueshifted into reddish with 5-10Â° without an issue (it's already the darkest color you picked), while for 20, maybe replace it with a color like RGB 170-170-85.

Hi @GraionDilach 
Sorry, I was just about to post this new one and then I saw you comment, so this does not yet reflect your comments...

But since it's quite time consuming for me to make these. Can you please take another look at the new one and tell me which of your suggestions still apply.
Thanks.

![openra_colors_select_pi99y2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10639257/15509046/516df574-21d2-11e6-9441-6761a24a49a0.png)
1-17 still needs tweak. Everything excluding 7-12 from my previous comments still apply as well.
OK thanks, I'll make a new version - but probably not before tommorow morning (in ~15 hours).

OK, so I tried to address the things you pointed out @GraionDilach. I eventually ended up with so many corrections and swaps, that I just corrected it again based on my observation ... IDK, I really hope it's better. I've pushed the colors I feel are less unique to the end of the list so they will get used less frequently.

at 100%
![ra_colors_pi99y_v3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10639257/15537332/0c64c3d2-2276-11e6-93e6-fd9bf82a4570.png)

at 200%
![ra_colors_pi99y_v3double](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10639257/15537347/1cee6c26-2276-11e6-9132-8a5eeb2e6bc6.png)

```
color codes:
01 #91d2ff
02 #ff261f
03 #75f107
04 #ffffff
05 #fdff0e
06 #ce00ff
07 #1a20ff
08 #ff7e00
09 #90ffad
10 #b90258
11 #000000
12 #ff91f6
13 #00a2ff
14 #fff7c3
15 #02b3a5
16 #098e00
17 #a9a9a9
18 #ccacff
19 #5a5cab
20 #c79679


```

As a reference for further color validator improvements:
- darker colors (on samall units) are harder to distinguish, especially on snow (light background)
- some light colors (like white) work good even on snow

Current validator bans white but allows many dark colors.

Isn't white used by the tech buildings?

4-12 is a problem, 9-13-15 as well. Why did you rejected my #AAAA55 suggestion?

I'll look in to it some more. I didn't reject anything but one change led to another and so on and I just wasn't able to apply your comments to the constantly changing version... Now that this is hopefuilly a better starting point it will maybe be easier. I'll report back with a new version.

BTW what kind od monitor are you viewing this on? Combinations you mention are quite clear here on two different screens. One callibrated higher-end one and one a cheap smart phone. I'm not saying they don't need change, I just don't want to go in the wrong direction. I know differences should be visible on standard monitor and as far as I can tell I did everything (soft proofing and trying a differnet, cheaper screen) to combat that. Does the difference between those colors becomes any clearer if you fiddle with your setting, like brightness?

Anyway I'll do some more color fiddling and post updates :)
Just to be more sure: Can you please confirm what you're seeing on another screen? Thanks.

ASUS VW221D - http://www.cnet.com/products/asus-vw221d-lcd-monitor-21-6-series/specs/  - preset Standard mode. Although I went through the presets now and Standard seems to desaturate everything a bit, although the others seemingly have biased-toward-a-particular-color setups. Infact, the only time I can't see 4-14 a problem, I have to switch to Theater Mode (where I have controls over saturation) and have to increase saturation so that Github comment button becomes glowingly bright green, etc.
Okay, rechecked it on my sister's ASUS VW195 (Noidea how that monitor is set up though). Only 4-14 is a problem, the 9-13-15 apparently blends due to ym preset.
Thanks for testing it. I will continue with this tomorrow + check two other displays to have a better understanding of what is acceptable for most setups.
